page.title: 17IRVINE * MARYMASS FAIR (1)
page.content: { {The Marymass fair}dates back to the 12th century, but the horse races which are held after the crowning ceremony, and procession on Irvine Moor, are over a thousand years old and may be the oldest in Europe. It begins every year in Irvine on either the third or fourth Saturday in August, and lasts a week.The{name {of the fair}comes from the parish church which was dedicated to the Virgin Mary, but later it became associated with Mary Queen of Scots, which is why the Marymass Queen is always dressed as Queen Mary. On the Sunday before the fair there is a church service,and during the next week a Gala day takes place, with racing, a gymkhana, a football match and fireworks.
